plain: Johnny Mnemonic, Judge Dredd, Stargate, Timecop, Demolition Man, The Lawnmower Man, Star Wars Episode V: The Empire Strikes Back, Aliens, A Clockwork Orange, Alien, Terminator Salvation, Back to the Future, Akira, The Fifth Element, Spawn, Alien Resurrection, Blade, The Matrix, Star Wars Episode I: The Phantom Menace, Total Recall, RoboCop 2, Being John Malkovich, The World Is Not Enough, Predator 2. These movies are all action, science fiction, or fantasy. They all have complex plots, often involving time travel, alternate realities, or alien invasions. The musical scores are often epic and atmospheric, ranging from futuristic synth scores to orchestral soundtracks. The mood of the scores is often intense and dramatic, with a mix of action and emotion. The settings vary widely, from futuristic cities to alien worlds to alternate universes. The visual styles are also varied, ranging from realistic effects to animated or comic book-inspired visuals. The writing styles are often complex and thought-provoking, exploring deep themes and philosophical questions. The runtimes are typically longer, ranging from 90 minutes to 3 hours. The themes are often exploration of the human condition, questioning the nature of reality, and the consequences of technological advancement.
